questions.text: Where did Rebecca go to college?
questions.explanation:
University of Connecticut.

	Frasier heard some news about Rebecca's college days. However, they wanted to verify that it was indeed that Rebecca Howe that he heard the information from.

questions.text: When did Ma Clavin say Yorkshire pudding was invented?
questions.explanation:
1770s.

	Yorkshire pudding consists of milk, water, flour and eggs. It was invented as early as 1737.

questions.text: What did Ma Clavin think Cliff did too often?
questions.explanation:
sliding down the banister.

	Ma Clavin told Cliff this when they were looking at old pictures. She was hoping that seeing the old pictures of his life in the house would persuade him to not want to sell the house.

questions.text: Why did Cliff spend so much time in the closet?
questions.correct: Ma Clavin locked the door on him.
options: Ma Clavin and he played hide n seek a lot.
He got lost because the closet was so big.
questions.explanation:
Ma Clavin locked the door on him.

	When Cliff told his mom that he was in there for hours she said "Well look at the results, you're a very polite young man." She and Cliff had a very strange relationship.

questions.text: What did Cliff name the elm tree he planted as a boy?
questions.explanation:
Elmer.

	Cliff used to sit in his tree for hours. When he remembered this part of his childhood he decided he couldn't let the house be sold. He then went to sit in his tree.

questions.text: What was Rebecca's nickname in college?
questions.explanation:
Backseat Becky.

	Sam was dying to know how Rebecca got her nickname but she wouldn't tell him the truth. She first told the guys she was "a real go-getter", that she "never took a back seat to anybody". They didn't believe her, however.

questions.text: How much did the man offer Ma Clavin for her house?
questions.explanation:
$250,000.

	Ma Clavin quickly agreed to sell the house, much to Cliff's dismay. She decided the house was just a house but a quarter of a million dollars was too much to pass up.

questions.text: Where did Ma Clavin say she could move to?
questions.explanation:
Florida.

	I am not sure when she made the move, but Ma Clavin eventually did move to Florida. Cliff had to learn to live on his own after 30 years of living with his mom.

questions.text: How much did Rebecca pay Carla for the story of how she got her nickname in college?
questions.explanation:
$10.

	Rebecca told Sam a story about how she was making out with a fireman in the backseat of the car. And it turned out everyone saw them. Carla told her the $20 story would have killed him (meaning Sam).

questions.text: What did Cliff do to keep his house from being sold?
options: Beat up the man who tried to destroy the house
questions.explanation:
Handcuffed himself to the house.

	Norm sawed the pole Cliff was handcuffed to, to get him out. This caused the house to fall apart as they were leaving. Cliff said, "A quarter of a million for this dump".
